eval_word_spacing()

The basic measure is the number of characters in contextually confirmed words. (I.e the word is done) If all words are contextually confirmed the evaluation is deemed perfect.

Some fiddles are done to handle "1"s as these are VERY frequent causes of fuzzy spaces. The problem with the basic measure is that "561 63" would score the same as "56163", though given our knowledge that the space is fuzzy, and that there is a "1" next to the fuzzy space, we need to ensure that "56163" is prefered.

The solution is to NOT COUNT the score of any word which has a digit at one end and a "1Il" as the character the other side of the space.

Conversly, any character next to a "1" within a word is counted as a positive score. Thus "561 63" would score 4 (3 chars in a numeric word plus 1 side of the "1" joined). "56163" would score 7 - all chars in a numeric word + 2 sides of a "1" joined.

The joined 1 rule is applied to any word REGARDLESS of contextual confirmation. Thus "PS7a71 3/7a" scores 1 (neither word is contexutally confirmed. The only score is from the joined 1. "PS7a713/7a" scores 2.

BOOL8 digit_or_numeric_punct (WERD_RES *word, int char_position)
 
inT16 eval_word_spacing (WERD_RES_LIST &word_res_list)
 
fix_sp_fp_word()

Test the current word to see if it can be split by deleting noise blobs. If so, do the business. Return with the iterator pointing to the same place if the word is unchanged, or the last of the replacement words.

void fix_noisy_space_list (WERD_RES_LIST &best_perm, ROW *row, BLOCK *block)

fix_fuzzy_spaces()

Walk over the page finding sequences of words joined by fuzzy spaces. Extract them as a sublist, process the sublist to find the optimal arrangement of spaces then replace the sublist in the ROW_RES.

Parameters
monitorprogress monitor
word_countcount of words in doc
[out]page_res
void fix_fuzzy_space_list (WERD_RES_LIST &best_perm, ROW *row, BLOCK *block)

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

tesseract::Tesseract::Tesseract ( )

Definition at line 37 of file tesseractclass.cpp.

38  : BOOL_MEMBER(tessedit_resegment_from_boxes, false,
39  "Take segmentation and labeling from box file",
40  this->params()),
41  BOOL_MEMBER(tessedit_resegment_from_line_boxes, false,
42  "Conversion of word/line box file to char box file",

48  BOOL_MEMBER(tessedit_dump_pageseg_images, false,
49  "Dump intermediate images made during page segmentation",
50  this->params()),
51  // The default for pageseg_mode is the old behaviour, so as not to
52  // upset anything that relies on that.
53  INT_MEMBER(tessedit_pageseg_mode, PSM_SINGLE_BLOCK,
54  "Page seg mode: 0=osd only, 1=auto+osd, 2=auto, 3=col, 4=block,"
55  " 5=line, 6=word, 7=char"
56  " (Values from PageSegMode enum in publictypes.h)",
57  this->params()),

60  " Defaults to loading and running only Tesseract"
61  " (no Cube,no combiner)."

63  this->params()),

422 
423  // The following parameters were deprecated and removed from their original
424  // locations. The parameters are temporarily kept here to give Tesseract
425  // users a chance to updated their [lang].traineddata and config files
426  // without introducing failures during Tesseract initialization.
427  // TODO(ocr-team): remove these parameters from the code once we are
428  // reasonably sure that Tesseract users have updated their data files.
429  //
430  // BEGIN DEPRECATED PARAMETERS
431  INT_MEMBER(tessedit_ok_mode, 5,
432  "Acceptance decision algorithm", this->params()),
433  BOOL_INIT_MEMBER(load_fixed_length_dawgs, true, "Load fixed length dawgs"
434  " (e.g. for non-space delimited languages)",
435  this->params()),
436  INT_MEMBER(segment_debug, 0, "Debug the whole segmentation process",
437  this->params()),
438  BOOL_MEMBER(permute_debug, 0, "Debug char permutation process",
439  this->params()),
440  double_MEMBER(bestrate_pruning_factor, 2.0, "Multiplying factor of"
441  " current best rate to prune other hypotheses",
442  this->params()),
443  BOOL_MEMBER(permute_script_word, 0,
444  "Turn on word script consistency permuter",
445  this->params()),
446  BOOL_MEMBER(segment_segcost_rating, 0,
447  "incorporate segmentation cost in word rating?",
448  this->params()),
449  double_MEMBER(segment_reward_script, 0.95,
450  "Score multipler for script consistency within a word. "
451  "Being a 'reward' factor, it should be <= 1. "
452  "Smaller value implies bigger reward.",
453  this->params()),
454  BOOL_MEMBER(permute_fixed_length_dawg, 0,
455  "Turn on fixed-length phrasebook search permuter",
456  this->params()),
457  BOOL_MEMBER(permute_chartype_word, 0,
458  "Turn on character type (property) consistency permuter",
459  this->params()),
460  double_MEMBER(segment_reward_chartype, 0.97,
461  "Score multipler for char type consistency within a word. ",
462  this->params()),
463  double_MEMBER(segment_reward_ngram_best_choice, 0.99,
464  "Score multipler for ngram permuter's best choice"
465  " (only used in the Han script path).",
466  this->params()),
467  BOOL_MEMBER(ngram_permuter_activated, false,
468  "Activate character-level n-gram-based permuter",
469  this->params()),
470  BOOL_MEMBER(permute_only_top, false, "Run only the top choice permuter",
471  this->params()),
472  INT_MEMBER(language_model_fixed_length_choices_depth, 3,
473  "Depth of blob choice lists to explore"
474  " when fixed length dawgs are on",
475  this->params()),
476  BOOL_MEMBER(use_new_state_cost, FALSE,
477  "use new state cost heuristics for segmentation state"
478  " evaluation", this->params()),
479  double_MEMBER(heuristic_segcost_rating_base, 1.25,
480  "base factor for adding segmentation cost into word rating."
481  "It's a multiplying factor, the larger the value above 1, "
482  "the bigger the effect of segmentation cost.",
483  this->params()),
484  double_MEMBER(heuristic_weight_rating, 1.0,
485  "weight associated with char rating in combined cost of"
486  "state", this->params()),
487  double_MEMBER(heuristic_weight_width, 1000.0,
488  "weight associated with width evidence in combined cost of"
489  " state", this->params()),
490  double_MEMBER(heuristic_weight_seamcut, 0.0,
491  "weight associated with seam cut in combined cost of state",
492  this->params()),
493  double_MEMBER(heuristic_max_char_wh_ratio, 2.0,
494  "max char width-to-height ratio allowed in segmentation",
495  this->params()),
496  BOOL_MEMBER(enable_new_segsearch, true,
497  "Enable new segmentation search path.", this->params()),
498  double_MEMBER(segsearch_max_fixed_pitch_char_wh_ratio, 2.0,
499  "Maximum character width-to-height ratio for"
500  " fixed-pitch fonts",
501  this->params()),
502  // END DEPRECATED PARAMETERS
503 
504  backup_config_file_(NULL),
505  pix_binary_(NULL),
506  cube_binary_(NULL),
507  pix_grey_(NULL),
508  pix_thresholds_(NULL),
509  source_resolution_(0),
510  textord_(this),
511  right_to_left_(false),
512  scaled_color_(NULL),
513  scaled_factor_(-1),

515  reskew_(1.0f, 0.0f),

517  font_table_size_(0),

422  {
423  BOOL8 prev_digit = FALSE;
424 
425  if (*lengths == 1 && *s == '(')
426  s++;
427 
428  if (*lengths == 1 &&
429  ((*s == '$') || (*s == '.') || (*s == '+') || (*s == '-')))
430  s++;
431 
432  for (; *s != '\0'; s += *(lengths++)) {
433  if (unicharset.get_isdigit(s, *lengths))
434  prev_digit = TRUE;
435  else if (prev_digit &&
436  (*lengths == 1 && ((*s == '.') || (*s == ',') || (*s == '-'))))
437  prev_digit = FALSE;
438  else if (prev_digit && *lengths == 1 &&
439  (*(s + *lengths) == '\0') && ((*s == '%') || (*s == ')')))
440  return TRUE;
441  else if (prev_digit &&
442  *lengths == 1 && (*s == '%') &&
443  (*(lengths + 1) == 1 && *(s + *lengths) == ')') &&
444  (*(s + *lengths + *(lengths + 1)) == '\0'))
445  return TRUE;
446  else
447  return FALSE;
448  }
449  return TRUE;
450 }

ACCEPTABLE_WERD_TYPE tesseract::Tesseract::acceptable_word_string ( const UNICHARSET &  char_set,

Definition at line 1267 of file control.cpp.

1268  {
1269  int i = 0;
1270  int offset = 0;
1271  int leading_punct_count;
1272  int upper_count = 0;
1273  int hyphen_pos = -1;
1274  ACCEPTABLE_WERD_TYPE word_type = AC_UNACCEPTABLE;
1275 
1276  if (strlen (lengths) > 20)
1277  return word_type;
1278 
1279  /* Single Leading punctuation char*/
1280 
1281  if (s[offset] != '\0' && STRING(chs_leading_punct).contains(s[offset]))
1282  offset += lengths[i++];
1283  leading_punct_count = i;
1284 
1285  /* Initial cap */
1286  while (s[offset] != '\0' && char_set.get_isupper(s + offset, lengths[i])) {
1287  offset += lengths[i++];
1288  upper_count++;
1289  }
1290  if (upper_count > 1) {
1291  word_type = AC_UPPER_CASE;
1292  } else {
1293  /* Lower case word, possibly with an initial cap */
1294  while (s[offset] != '\0' && char_set.get_islower(s + offset, lengths[i])) {
1295  offset += lengths[i++];
1296  }
1297  if (i - leading_punct_count < quality_min_initial_alphas_reqd)
1298  goto not_a_word;
1299  /*
1300  Allow a single hyphen in a lower case word
1301  - dont trust upper case - I've seen several cases of "H" -> "I-I"
1302  */
1303  if (lengths[i] == 1 && s[offset] == '-') {
1304  hyphen_pos = i;
1305  offset += lengths[i++];
1306  if (s[offset] != '\0') {
1307  while ((s[offset] != '\0') &&
1308  char_set.get_islower(s + offset, lengths[i])) {
1309  offset += lengths[i++];
1310  }
1311  if (i < hyphen_pos + 3)
1312  goto not_a_word;
1313  }
1314  } else {
1315  /* Allow "'s" in NON hyphenated lower case words */
1316  if (lengths[i] == 1 && (s[offset] == '\'') &&
1317  lengths[i + 1] == 1 && (s[offset + lengths[i]] == 's')) {
1318  offset += lengths[i++];
1319  offset += lengths[i++];
1320  }
1321  }
1322  if (upper_count > 0)
1323  word_type = AC_INITIAL_CAP;
1324  else
1325  word_type = AC_LOWER_CASE;
1326  }
1327 
1328  /* Up to two different, constrained trailing punctuation chars */
1329  if (lengths[i] == 1 && s[offset] != '\0' &&
1330  STRING(chs_trailing_punct1).contains(s[offset]))
1331  offset += lengths[i++];
1332  if (lengths[i] == 1 && s[offset] != '\0' && i > 0 &&
1333  s[offset - lengths[i - 1]] != s[offset] &&
1334  STRING(chs_trailing_punct2).contains (s[offset]))
1335  offset += lengths[i++];
1336 
1337  if (s[offset] != '\0')
1338  word_type = AC_UNACCEPTABLE;
1339 
1340  not_a_word:
1341 
1342  if (word_type == AC_UNACCEPTABLE) {
1343  /* Look for abbreviation string */
1344  i = 0;
1345  offset = 0;
1346  if (s[0] != '\0' && char_set.get_isupper(s, lengths[0])) {
1347  word_type = AC_UC_ABBREV;
1348  while (s[offset] != '\0' &&
1349  char_set.get_isupper(s + offset, lengths[i]) &&
1350  lengths[i + 1] == 1 && s[offset + lengths[i]] == '.') {
1351  offset += lengths[i++];
1352  offset += lengths[i++];
1353  }
1354  }
1355  else if (s[0] != '\0' && char_set.get_islower(s, lengths[0])) {
1356  word_type = AC_LC_ABBREV;
1357  while (s[offset] != '\0' &&
1358  char_set.get_islower(s + offset, lengths[i]) &&
1359  lengths[i + 1] == 1 && s[offset + lengths[i]] == '.') {
1360  offset += lengths[i++];
1361  offset += lengths[i++];
1362  }
1363  }
1364  if (s[offset] != '\0')
1365  word_type = AC_UNACCEPTABLE;
1366  }
1367 
1368  return word_type;
1369 }
AC_UPPER_CASE
ALL upper case.

Definition at line 110 of file applybox.cpp.

112  {
113  GenericVector<TBOX> boxes;
114  GenericVector<STRING> texts, full_texts;
115  if (!ReadAllBoxes(applybox_page, true, fname, &boxes, &texts, &full_texts,
116  NULL)) {
117  return NULL; // Can't do it.
118  }
119 
120  int box_count = boxes.size();
121  int box_failures = 0;
122  // Add an empty everything to the end.
123  boxes.push_back(TBOX());
124  texts.push_back(STRING());
125  full_texts.push_back(STRING());
126 
127  // In word mode, we use the boxes to make a word for each box, but
128  // in blob mode we use the existing words and maximally chop them first.
129  PAGE_RES* page_res = find_segmentation ?
130  NULL : SetupApplyBoxes(boxes, block_list);
131  clear_any_old_text(block_list);
132 
133  for (int i = 0; i < boxes.size() - 1; i++) {
134  bool foundit = false;
135  if (page_res != NULL) {
136  if (i == 0) {
137  foundit = ResegmentCharBox(page_res, NULL, boxes[i], boxes[i + 1],
138  full_texts[i].string());
139  } else {
140  foundit = ResegmentCharBox(page_res, &boxes[i-1], boxes[i],
141  boxes[i + 1], full_texts[i].string());
142  }
143  } else {
144  foundit = ResegmentWordBox(block_list, boxes[i], boxes[i + 1],
145  texts[i].string());
146  }
147  if (!foundit) {
148  box_failures++;
149  ReportFailedBox(i, boxes[i], texts[i].string(),
150  "FAILURE! Couldn't find a matching blob");
151  }
152  }
153 
154  if (page_res == NULL) {
155  // In word/line mode, we now maximally chop all the words and resegment
156  // them with the classifier.
157  page_res = SetupApplyBoxes(boxes, block_list);
158  ReSegmentByClassification(page_res);
159  }
160  if (applybox_debug > 0) {
161  tprintf("APPLY_BOXES:\n");
162  tprintf(" Boxes read from boxfile: %6d\n", box_count);
163  if (box_failures > 0)
164  tprintf(" Boxes failed resegmentation: %6d\n", box_failures);
165  }
166  TidyUp(page_res);
167  return page_res;
168 }

Definition: pageres.h:175
NULL
#define NULL
Definition: host.h:144
int tesseract::Tesseract::AutoPageSeg ( PageSegMode  pageseg_mode,
BLOCK_LIST *  blocks,
TO_BLOCK_LIST *  to_blocks,
Tesseract *  osd_tess,
OSResults *  osr 
)

Auto page segmentation. Divide the page image into blocks of uniform text linespacing and images.

Resolution (in ppi) is derived from the input image.

The output goes in the blocks list with corresponding TO_BLOCKs in the to_blocks list.

If single_column is true, then no attempt is made to divide the image into columns, but multiple blocks are still made if the text is of non-uniform linespacing.

If osd (orientation and script detection) is true then that is performed as well. If only_osd is true, then only orientation and script detection is performed. If osd is desired, (osd or only_osd) then osr_tess must be another Tesseract that was initialized especially for osd, and the results will be output into osr (orientation and script result).

Definition at line 220 of file pagesegmain.cpp.

222  {
223  if (textord_debug_images) {
224  WriteDebugBackgroundImage(textord_debug_printable, pix_binary_);
225  }
226  Pix* photomask_pix = NULL;
227  Pix* musicmask_pix = NULL;
228  // The blocks made by the ColumnFinder. Moved to blocks before return.
229  BLOCK_LIST found_blocks;
230  TO_BLOCK_LIST temp_blocks;
231 
232  bool single_column = !PSM_COL_FIND_ENABLED(pageseg_mode);
233  bool osd_enabled = PSM_OSD_ENABLED(pageseg_mode);
234  bool osd_only = pageseg_mode == PSM_OSD_ONLY;
235  ColumnFinder* finder = SetupPageSegAndDetectOrientation(
236  single_column, osd_enabled, osd_only, blocks, osd_tess, osr,
237  &temp_blocks, &photomask_pix, &musicmask_pix);
238  int result = 0;
239  if (finder != NULL) {
240  TO_BLOCK_IT to_block_it(&temp_blocks);
241  TO_BLOCK* to_block = to_block_it.data();
242  if (musicmask_pix != NULL) {
243  // TODO(rays) pass the musicmask_pix into FindBlocks and mark music
244  // blocks separately. For now combine with photomask_pix.
245  pixOr(photomask_pix, photomask_pix, musicmask_pix);
246  }
247  if (equ_detect_) {
248  finder->SetEquationDetect(equ_detect_);
249  }
250  result = finder->FindBlocks(pageseg_mode, scaled_color_, scaled_factor_,
251  to_block, photomask_pix,
252  pix_thresholds_, pix_grey_,
253  &found_blocks, to_blocks);
254  if (result >= 0)
255  finder->GetDeskewVectors(&deskew_, &reskew_);
256  delete finder;
257  }
258  pixDestroy(&photomask_pix);
259  pixDestroy(&musicmask_pix);
260  if (result < 0) return result;
261 
262  blocks->clear();
263  BLOCK_IT block_it(blocks);
264  // Move the found blocks to the input/output blocks.
265  block_it.add_list_after(&found_blocks);
266 
267  if (textord_debug_images) {
268  // The debug image is no longer needed so delete it.
269  unlink(AlignedBlob::textord_debug_pix().string());
270  }
271  return result;
272 }

Definition: blobbox.h:679
tesseract::Tesseract::SetupPageSegAndDetectOrientation
ColumnFinder * SetupPageSegAndDetectOrientation(bool single_column, bool osd, bool only_osd, BLOCK_LIST *blocks, Tesseract *osd_tess, OSResults *osr, TO_BLOCK_LIST *to_blocks, Pix **photo_mask_pix, Pix **music_mask_pix)

static const STRING & textord_debug_pix()
Definition: alignedblob.h:112

#define NULL
Definition: host.h:144
textord_debug_printable
bool textord_debug_printable
Definition: alignedblob.cpp:34
tesseract::PSM_OSD_ENABLED
bool PSM_OSD_ENABLED(int pageseg_mode)
Definition: publictypes.h:179
bool tesseract::Tesseract::BelievableSuperscript ( bool  debug,
const WERD_RES &  word,
float  certainty_threshold,
int *  left_ok,
int *  right_ok 
) const

Return whether this is believable superscript or subscript text.

We insist that:

  • there are no punctuation marks.
  • there are no italics.
  • no normal-sized character is smaller than superscript_scaledown_ratio of what it ought to be, and
  • each character is at least as certain as certainty_threshold.
Parameters
[in]debugIf true, spew debug output
[in]wordThe word whose best_choice we're evaluating
[in]certainty_thresholdIf any of the characters have less certainty than this, reject.
[out]left_okHow many left-side characters were ok?
[out]right_okHow many right-side characters were ok?
Returns
Whether the complete best choice is believable as a superscript.

Definition at line 520 of file superscript.cpp.

524  {
525  int initial_ok_run_count = 0;
526  int ok_run_count = 0;
527  float worst_certainty = 0.0f;
528  const WERD_CHOICE &wc = *word.best_choice;
529 
530  const UnicityTable<FontInfo>& fontinfo_table = get_fontinfo_table();
531  for (int i = 0; i < wc.length(); i++) {
532  TBLOB *blob = word.rebuild_word->blobs[i];
533  UNICHAR_ID unichar_id = wc.unichar_id(i);
534  float char_certainty = wc.certainty(i);
535  bool bad_certainty = char_certainty < certainty_threshold;
536  bool is_punc = wc.unicharset()->get_ispunctuation(unichar_id);
537  bool is_italic = word.fontinfo && word.fontinfo->is_italic();
538  BLOB_CHOICE *choice = word.GetBlobChoice(i);
539  if (choice && fontinfo_table.size() > 0) {
540  // Get better information from the specific choice, if available.
541  int font_id1 = choice->fontinfo_id();
542  bool font1_is_italic = font_id1 >= 0
543  ? fontinfo_table.get(font_id1).is_italic() : false;
544  int font_id2 = choice->fontinfo_id2();
545  is_italic = font1_is_italic &&
546  (font_id2 < 0 || fontinfo_table.get(font_id2).is_italic());
547  }
548 
549  float height_fraction = 1.0f;
550  float char_height = blob->bounding_box().height();
551  float normal_height = char_height;
552  if (wc.unicharset()->top_bottom_useful()) {
553  int min_bot, max_bot, min_top, max_top;
554  wc.unicharset()->get_top_bottom(unichar_id,
555  &min_bot, &max_bot,
556  &min_top, &max_top);
557  float hi_height = max_top - max_bot;
558  float lo_height = min_top - min_bot;
559  normal_height = (hi_height + lo_height) / 2;
560  if (normal_height >= kBlnXHeight) {
561  // Only ding characters that we have decent information for because
562  // they're supposed to be normal sized, not tiny specks or dashes.
563  height_fraction = char_height / normal_height;
564  }
565  }
566  bool bad_height = height_fraction < superscript_scaledown_ratio;
567 
568  if (debug) {
569  if (is_italic) {
570  tprintf(" Rejecting: superscript is italic.\n");
571  }
572  if (is_punc) {
573  tprintf(" Rejecting: punctuation present.\n");
574  }
575  const char *char_str = wc.unicharset()->id_to_unichar(unichar_id);
576  if (bad_certainty) {
577  tprintf(" Rejecting: don't believe character %s with certainty %.2f "
578  "which is less than threshold %.2f\n", char_str,
579  char_certainty, certainty_threshold);
580  }
581  if (bad_height) {
582  tprintf(" Rejecting: character %s seems too small @ %.2f versus "
583  "expected %.2f\n", char_str, char_height, normal_height);
584  }
585  }
586  if (bad_certainty || bad_height || is_punc || is_italic) {
587  if (ok_run_count == i) {
588  initial_ok_run_count = ok_run_count;
589  }
590  ok_run_count = 0;
591  } else {
592  ok_run_count++;
593  }
594  if (char_certainty < worst_certainty) {
595  worst_certainty = char_certainty;
596  }
597  }
598  bool all_ok = ok_run_count == wc.length();
599  if (all_ok && debug) {
600  tprintf(" Accept: worst revised certainty is %.2f\n", worst_certainty);
601  }
602  if (!all_ok) {
603  if (left_ok) *left_ok = initial_ok_run_count;
604  if (right_ok) *right_ok = ok_run_count;
605  }
606  return all_ok;
607 }
UNICHARSET::id_to_unichar

Definition: host.h:144
void tesseract::Tesseract::bigram_correction_pass ( PAGE_RES *  page_res)

Definition at line 435 of file control.cpp.

435  {
436  PAGE_RES_IT word_it(page_res);
437 
438  WERD_RES *w_prev = NULL;
439  WERD_RES *w = word_it.word();
440  while (1) {
441  w_prev = w;
442  while (word_it.forward() != NULL &&
443  (!word_it.word() || word_it.word()->part_of_combo)) {
444  // advance word_it, skipping over parts of combos
445  }
446  if (!word_it.word()) break;
447  w = word_it.word();
448  if (!w || !w_prev || w->uch_set != w_prev->uch_set) {
449  continue;
450  }
451  if (w_prev->word->flag(W_REP_CHAR) || w->word->flag(W_REP_CHAR)) {
452  if (tessedit_bigram_debug) {
453  tprintf("Skipping because one of the words is W_REP_CHAR\n");
454  }
455  continue;
456  }
457  // Two words sharing the same language model, excellent!
458  GenericVector<WERD_CHOICE *> overrides_word1;
459  GenericVector<WERD_CHOICE *> overrides_word2;
460 
461  STRING orig_w1_str = w_prev->best_choice->unichar_string();
462  STRING orig_w2_str = w->best_choice->unichar_string();
463  WERD_CHOICE prev_best(w->uch_set);
464  {
465  int w1start, w1end;
466  w_prev->best_choice->GetNonSuperscriptSpan(&w1start, &w1end);
467  prev_best = w_prev->best_choice->shallow_copy(w1start, w1end);
468  }
469  WERD_CHOICE this_best(w->uch_set);
470  {
471  int w2start, w2end;
472  w->best_choice->GetNonSuperscriptSpan(&w2start, &w2end);
473  this_best = w->best_choice->shallow_copy(w2start, w2end);
474  }
475 
476  if (w->tesseract->getDict().valid_bigram(prev_best, this_best)) {
477  if (tessedit_bigram_debug) {
478  tprintf("Top choice \"%s %s\" verified by bigram model.\n",
479  orig_w1_str.string(), orig_w2_str.string());
480  }
481  continue;
482  }
483  if (tessedit_bigram_debug > 2) {
484  tprintf("Examining alt choices for \"%s %s\".\n",
485  orig_w1_str.string(), orig_w2_str.string());
486  }
487  if (tessedit_bigram_debug > 1) {
488  if (!w_prev->best_choices.singleton()) {
489  w_prev->PrintBestChoices();
490  }
491  if (!w->best_choices.singleton()) {
492  w->PrintBestChoices();
493  }
494  }
495  float best_rating = 0.0;
496  int best_idx = 0;
497  WERD_CHOICE_IT prev_it(&w_prev->best_choices);
498  for (prev_it.mark_cycle_pt(); !prev_it.cycled_list(); prev_it.forward()) {
499  WERD_CHOICE *p1 = prev_it.data();
500  WERD_CHOICE strip1(w->uch_set);
501  {
502  int p1start, p1end;
503  p1->GetNonSuperscriptSpan(&p1start, &p1end);
504  strip1 = p1->shallow_copy(p1start, p1end);
505  }
506  WERD_CHOICE_IT w_it(&w->best_choices);
507  for (w_it.mark_cycle_pt(); !w_it.cycled_list(); w_it.forward()) {
508  WERD_CHOICE *p2 = w_it.data();
509  WERD_CHOICE strip2(w->uch_set);
510  {
511  int p2start, p2end;
512  p2->GetNonSuperscriptSpan(&p2start, &p2end);
513  strip2 = p2->shallow_copy(p2start, p2end);
514  }
515  if (w->tesseract->getDict().valid_bigram(strip1, strip2)) {
516  overrides_word1.push_back(p1);
517  overrides_word2.push_back(p2);
518  if (overrides_word1.size() == 1 ||
519  p1->rating() + p2->rating() < best_rating) {
520  best_rating = p1->rating() + p2->rating();
521  best_idx = overrides_word1.size() - 1;
522  }
523  }
524  }
525  }
526  if (overrides_word1.size() >= 1) {
527  // Excellent, we have some bigram matches.
528  if (EqualIgnoringCaseAndTerminalPunct(*w_prev->best_choice,
529  *overrides_word1[best_idx]) &&
530  EqualIgnoringCaseAndTerminalPunct(*w->best_choice,
531  *overrides_word2[best_idx])) {
532  if (tessedit_bigram_debug > 1) {
533  tprintf("Top choice \"%s %s\" verified (sans case) by bigram "
534  "model.\n", orig_w1_str.string(), orig_w2_str.string());
535  }
536  continue;
537  }
538  STRING new_w1_str = overrides_word1[best_idx]->unichar_string();
539  STRING new_w2_str = overrides_word2[best_idx]->unichar_string();
540  if (new_w1_str != orig_w1_str) {
541  w_prev->ReplaceBestChoice(overrides_word1[best_idx]);
542  }
543  if (new_w2_str != orig_w2_str) {
544  w->ReplaceBestChoice(overrides_word2[best_idx]);
545  }
546  if (tessedit_bigram_debug > 0) {
547  STRING choices_description;
548  int num_bigram_choices
549  = overrides_word1.size() * overrides_word2.size();
550  if (num_bigram_choices == 1) {
551  choices_description = "This was the unique bigram choice.";
552  } else {
553  if (tessedit_bigram_debug > 1) {
554  STRING bigrams_list;
555  const int kMaxChoicesToPrint = 20;
556  for (int i = 0; i < overrides_word1.size() &&
557  i < kMaxChoicesToPrint; i++) {
558  if (i > 0) { bigrams_list += ", "; }
559  WERD_CHOICE *p1 = overrides_word1[i];
560  WERD_CHOICE *p2 = overrides_word2[i];
561  bigrams_list += p1->unichar_string() + " " + p2->unichar_string();
562  if (i == kMaxChoicesToPrint) {
563  bigrams_list += " ...";
564  }
565  }
566  choices_description = "There were many choices: {";
567  choices_description += bigrams_list;
568  choices_description += "}";
569  } else {
570  choices_description.add_str_int("There were ", num_bigram_choices);
571  choices_description += " compatible bigrams.";
572  }
573  }
574  tprintf("Replaced \"%s %s\" with \"%s %s\" with bigram model. %s\n",
575  orig_w1_str.string(), orig_w2_str.string(),
576  new_w1_str.string(), new_w2_str.string(),
577  choices_description.string());
578  }
579  }
580  }
581 }

float tesseract::Tesseract::blob_noise_score ( TBLOB *  blob)

Definition at line 762 of file fixspace.cpp.

762  {
763  TBOX box; // BB of outline
764  inT16 outline_count = 0;
765  inT16 max_dimension;
766  inT16 largest_outline_dimension = 0;
767 
768  for (TESSLINE* ol = blob->outlines; ol != NULL; ol= ol->next) {
769  outline_count++;
770  box = ol->bounding_box();
771  if (box.height() > box.width()) {
772  max_dimension = box.height();
773  } else {
774  max_dimension = box.width();
775  }
776 
777  if (largest_outline_dimension < max_dimension)
778  largest_outline_dimension = max_dimension;
779  }
780 
781  if (outline_count > 5) {
782  // penalise LOTS of blobs
783  largest_outline_dimension *= 2;
784  }
785 
786  box = blob->bounding_box();
787  if (box.bottom() > kBlnBaselineOffset * 4 ||
788  box.top() < kBlnBaselineOffset / 2) {
789  // Lax blob is if high or low
790  largest_outline_dimension /= 2;
791  }
792 
793  return largest_outline_dimension;
794 }

void tesseract::Tesseract::break_noisiest_blob_word ( WERD_RES_LIST &  words)

break_noisiest_blob_word() Find the word with the blob which looks like the worst noise. Break the word into two, deleting the noise blob.

Definition at line 617 of file fixspace.cpp.

617  {
618  WERD_RES_IT word_it(&words);
619  WERD_RES_IT worst_word_it;
620  float worst_noise_score = 9999;
621  int worst_blob_index = -1; // Noisiest blob of noisiest wd
622  int blob_index; // of wds noisiest blob
623  float noise_score; // of wds noisiest blob
624  WERD_RES *word_res;
625  C_BLOB_IT blob_it;
626  C_BLOB_IT rej_cblob_it;
627  C_BLOB_LIST new_blob_list;
628  C_BLOB_IT new_blob_it;
629  C_BLOB_IT new_rej_cblob_it;
630  WERD *new_word;
631  inT16 start_of_noise_blob;
632  inT16 i;
633 
634  for (word_it.mark_cycle_pt(); !word_it.cycled_list(); word_it.forward()) {
635  blob_index = worst_noise_blob(word_it.data(), &noise_score);
636  if (blob_index > -1 && worst_noise_score > noise_score) {
637  worst_noise_score = noise_score;
638  worst_blob_index = blob_index;
639  worst_word_it = word_it;
640  }
641  }
642  if (worst_blob_index < 0) {
643  words.clear(); // signal termination
644  return;
645  }
646 
647  /* Now split the worst_word_it */
648 
649  word_res = worst_word_it.data();
650 
651  /* Move blobs before noise blob to a new bloblist */
652 
653  new_blob_it.set_to_list(&new_blob_list);
654  blob_it.set_to_list(word_res->word->cblob_list());
655  for (i = 0; i < worst_blob_index; i++, blob_it.forward()) {
656  new_blob_it.add_after_then_move(blob_it.extract());
657  }
658  start_of_noise_blob = blob_it.data()->bounding_box().left();
659  delete blob_it.extract(); // throw out noise blob
660 
661  new_word = new WERD(&new_blob_list, word_res->word);
662  new_word->set_flag(W_EOL, FALSE);
663  word_res->word->set_flag(W_BOL, FALSE);
664  word_res->word->set_blanks(1); // After break
665 
666  new_rej_cblob_it.set_to_list(new_word->rej_cblob_list());
667  rej_cblob_it.set_to_list(word_res->word->rej_cblob_list());
668  for (;
669  (!rej_cblob_it.empty() &&
670  (rej_cblob_it.data()->bounding_box().left() < start_of_noise_blob));
671  rej_cblob_it.forward()) {
672  new_rej_cblob_it.add_after_then_move(rej_cblob_it.extract());
673  }
674 
675  WERD_RES* new_word_res = new WERD_RES(new_word);
676  new_word_res->combination = TRUE;
677  worst_word_it.add_before_then_move(new_word_res);
678 
679  word_res->ClearResults();
680 }

Definition at line 908 of file control.cpp.

910  {
911  // Best result so far.
912  PointerVector<WERD_RES> best_words;
913  // Points to the best result. May be word or in lang_words.
914  WERD_RES* word = word_data->word;
915  clock_t start_t = clock();
916  if (classify_debug_level || cube_debug_level) {
917  tprintf("%s word with lang %s at:",
918  word->done ? "Already done" : "Processing",
919  most_recently_used_->lang.string());
920  word->word->bounding_box().print();
921  }
922  if (word->done) {
923  // If done on pass1, leave it as-is.
924  if (!word->tess_failed)
925  most_recently_used_ = word->tesseract;
926  return;
927  }
928  int sub = sub_langs_.size();
929  if (most_recently_used_ != this) {
930  // Get the index of the most_recently_used_.
931  for (sub = 0; sub < sub_langs_.size() &&
932  most_recently_used_ != sub_langs_[sub]; ++sub) {}
933  }
934  most_recently_used_->RetryWithLanguage(
935  *word_data, recognizer, &word_data->lang_words[sub], &best_words);
936  Tesseract* best_lang_tess = most_recently_used_;
937  if (!WordsAcceptable(best_words)) {
938  // Try all the other languages to see if they are any better.
939  if (most_recently_used_ != this &&
940  this->RetryWithLanguage(*word_data, recognizer,
941  &word_data->lang_words[sub_langs_.size()],
942  &best_words) > 0) {
943  best_lang_tess = this;
944  }
945  for (int i = 0; !WordsAcceptable(best_words) && i < sub_langs_.size();
946  ++i) {
947  if (most_recently_used_ != sub_langs_[i] &&
948  sub_langs_[i]->RetryWithLanguage(*word_data, recognizer,
949  &word_data->lang_words[i],
950  &best_words) > 0) {
951  best_lang_tess = sub_langs_[i];
952  }
953  }
954  }
955  most_recently_used_ = best_lang_tess;
956  if (!best_words.empty()) {
957  if (best_words.size() == 1 && !best_words[0]->combination) {
958  // Move the best single result to the main word.
959  word_data->word->ConsumeWordResults(best_words[0]);
960  } else {
961  // Words came from LSTM, and must be moved to the PAGE_RES properly.
962  word_data->word = best_words.back();
963  pr_it->ReplaceCurrentWord(&best_words);
964  }
965  ASSERT_HOST(word_data->word->box_word != NULL);
966  } else {
967  tprintf("no best words!!\n");
968  }
969  clock_t ocr_t = clock();
970  if (tessedit_timing_debug) {
971  tprintf("%s (ocr took %.2f sec)\n",
972  word->best_choice->unichar_string().string(),
973  static_cast<double>(ocr_t-start_t)/CLOCKS_PER_SEC);
974  }
975 }

classify_word_pass1

Baseline normalize the word and pass it to Tess.

Definition at line 983 of file control.cpp.

985  {
986  ROW* row = word_data.row;
987  BLOCK* block = word_data.block;
988  prev_word_best_choice_ = word_data.prev_word != NULL
989  ? word_data.prev_word->word->best_choice : NULL;
990  // If we only intend to run cube - run it and return.
991  if (tessedit_ocr_engine_mode == OEM_CUBE_ONLY) {
992  cube_word_pass1(block, row, *in_word);
993  return;
994  }
995  WERD_RES* word = *in_word;
996  match_word_pass_n(1, word, row, block);
997  if (!word->tess_failed && !word->word->flag(W_REP_CHAR)) {
998  word->tess_would_adapt = AdaptableWord(word);
999  bool adapt_ok = word_adaptable(word, tessedit_tess_adaption_mode);
1000 
1001  if (adapt_ok) {
1002  // Send word to adaptive classifier for training.
1003  word->BestChoiceToCorrectText();
1004  LearnWord(NULL, word);
1005  // Mark misadaptions if running blamer.
1006  if (word->blamer_bundle != NULL) {
1007  word->blamer_bundle->SetMisAdaptionDebug(word->best_choice,
1008  wordrec_debug_blamer);
1009  }
1010  }

1097  if (tessedit_ocr_engine_mode != OEM_TESSERACT_ONLY &&
1098  tessedit_ocr_engine_mode != OEM_TESSERACT_CUBE_COMBINED &&

1105  ? word_data.prev_word->word->best_choice : NULL;
1106

1109  if (!word->done) {
1110  word->caps_height = 0.0;
1111  if (word->x_height == 0.0f)

1121  block->classify_rotation().y() == 0.0f) {

float tesseract::Tesseract::ComputeCompatibleXheight ( WERD_RES *  word_res)

Definition at line 95 of file fixxht.cpp.

95  {
96  STATS top_stats(0, MAX_UINT8);
97  int num_blobs = word_res->rebuild_word->NumBlobs();
98  for (int blob_id = 0; blob_id < num_blobs; ++blob_id) {
99  TBLOB* blob = word_res->rebuild_word->blobs[blob_id];
100  UNICHAR_ID class_id = word_res->best_choice->unichar_id(blob_id);
101  if (unicharset.get_isalpha(class_id) || unicharset.get_isdigit(class_id)) {
102  int top = blob->bounding_box().top();
103  // Clip the top to the limit of normalized feature space.
104  if (top >= INT_FEAT_RANGE)
105  top = INT_FEAT_RANGE - 1;
106  int bottom = blob->bounding_box().bottom();
107  int min_bottom, max_bottom, min_top, max_top;
108  unicharset.get_top_bottom(class_id, &min_bottom, &max_bottom,
109  &min_top, &max_top);
110  // Chars with a wild top range would mess up the result so ignore them.
111  if (max_top - min_top > kMaxCharTopRange)
112  continue;
113  int misfit_dist = MAX((min_top - x_ht_acceptance_tolerance) - top,
114  top - (max_top + x_ht_acceptance_tolerance));
115  int height = top - kBlnBaselineOffset;
116  if (debug_x_ht_level >= 20) {
117  tprintf("Class %s: height=%d, bottom=%d,%d top=%d,%d, actual=%d,%d : ",
118  unicharset.id_to_unichar(class_id),
119  height, min_bottom, max_bottom, min_top, max_top,
120  bottom, top);
121  }
122  // Use only chars that fit in the expected bottom range, and where
123  // the range of tops is sensibly near the xheight.
124  if (min_bottom <= bottom + x_ht_acceptance_tolerance &&
125  bottom - x_ht_acceptance_tolerance <= max_bottom &&
126  min_top > kBlnBaselineOffset &&
127  max_top - kBlnBaselineOffset >= kBlnXHeight &&
128  misfit_dist > 0) {
129  // Compute the x-height position using proportionality between the
130  // actual height and expected height.
131  int min_xht = DivRounded(height * kBlnXHeight,
132  max_top - kBlnBaselineOffset);
133  int max_xht = DivRounded(height * kBlnXHeight,
134  min_top - kBlnBaselineOffset);
135  if (debug_x_ht_level >= 20) {
136  tprintf(" xht range min=%d, max=%d\n",
137  min_xht, max_xht);
138  }
139  // The range of expected heights gets a vote equal to the distance
140  // of the actual top from the expected top.
141  for (int y = min_xht; y <= max_xht; ++y)
142  top_stats.add(y, misfit_dist);
143  } else if (debug_x_ht_level >= 20) {
144  tprintf(" already OK\n");
145  }
146  }
147  }
148  if (top_stats.get_total() == 0)
149  return 0.0f;
150  // The new xheight is just the median vote, which is then scaled out
151  // of BLN space back to pixel space to get the x-height in pixel space.
152  float new_xht = top_stats.median();
153  if (debug_x_ht_level >= 20) {
154  tprintf("Median xht=%f\n", new_xht);
155  tprintf("Mode20:A: New x-height = %f (norm), %f (orig)\n",
156  new_xht, new_xht / word_res->denorm.y_scale());
157  }
158  // The xheight must change by at least x_ht_min_change to be used.
159  if (fabs(new_xht - kBlnXHeight) >= x_ht_min_change)
160  return new_xht / word_res->denorm.y_scale();
161  else
162  return 0.0f;
163 }

int x_ht_acceptance_tolerance

663  {
664  int i;
665  UNICHAR_ID unichar_dash = word_res->uch_set->unichar_to_id("-");
666  UNICHAR_ID unichar_space = word_res->uch_set->unichar_to_id(" ");
667  UNICHAR_ID unichar_tilde = word_res->uch_set->unichar_to_id("~");
668  UNICHAR_ID unichar_pow = word_res->uch_set->unichar_to_id("^");
669  for (i = 0; i < word_res->reject_map.length(); ++i) {
670  if (word_res->best_choice->unichar_id(i) == unichar_tilde) {
671  word_res->best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_dash, i);
672  if (word_res->reject_map[i].accepted ())
673  word_res->reject_map[i].setrej_unlv_rej ();
674  }
675  if (word_res->best_choice->unichar_id(i) == unichar_pow) {
676  word_res->best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_space, i);
677  if (word_res->reject_map[i].accepted ())
678  word_res->reject_map[i].setrej_unlv_rej ();
679  }

Definition at line 526 of file applybox.cpp.

527  {
528  for (int step = 0; *utf8 != '\0'; utf8 += step) {
529  const char* next_space = strchr(utf8, ' ');
530  if (next_space == NULL)
531  next_space = utf8 + strlen(utf8);
532  step = next_space - utf8;
533  UNICHAR_ID class_id = unicharset.unichar_to_id(utf8, step);
534  if (class_id == INVALID_UNICHAR_ID) {
535  return false;
536  }
537  while (utf8[step] == ' ')
538  ++step;
539  class_ids->push_back(class_id);
540  }
541  return true;
542 }

755  {
756  PAGE_RES_IT pr_it(page_res);
757  for (WERD_RES *word_res = pr_it.word(); word_res != NULL;
758  word_res = pr_it.forward()) {
759  WERD_CHOICE* choice = new WERD_CHOICE(word_res->uch_set,
760  word_res->correct_text.size());
761  for (int i = 0; i < word_res->correct_text.size(); ++i) {
762  // The part before the first space is the real ground truth, and the
763  // rest is the bounding box location and page number.
764  GenericVector<STRING> tokens;
765  word_res->correct_text[i].split(' ', &tokens);
766  UNICHAR_ID char_id = unicharset.unichar_to_id(tokens[0].string());
767  choice->append_unichar_id_space_allocated(char_id,
768  word_res->best_state[i],
769  0.0f, 0.0f);
770  }
771  word_res->ClearWordChoices();
772  word_res->LogNewRawChoice(choice);
773  word_res->LogNewCookedChoice(1, false, choice);
774  }
775 }

63  {
64  int bad_blobs = 0;
65  int num_blobs = word_res->rebuild_word->NumBlobs();
66  for (int blob_id = 0; blob_id < num_blobs; ++blob_id) {
67  TBLOB* blob = word_res->rebuild_word->blobs[blob_id];
68  UNICHAR_ID class_id = word_res->best_choice->unichar_id(blob_id);
69  if (unicharset.get_isalpha(class_id) || unicharset.get_isdigit(class_id)) {
70  int top = blob->bounding_box().top();
71  if (top >= INT_FEAT_RANGE)
72  top = INT_FEAT_RANGE - 1;
73  int min_bottom, max_bottom, min_top, max_top;
74  unicharset.get_top_bottom(class_id, &min_bottom, &max_bottom,
75  &min_top, &max_top);
76  if (max_top - min_top > kMaxCharTopRange)
77  continue;
78  bool bad = top < min_top - x_ht_acceptance_tolerance ||
79  top > max_top + x_ht_acceptance_tolerance;
80  if (bad)
81  ++bad_blobs;
82  if (debug_x_ht_level >= 1) {
83  tprintf("Class %s is %s with top %d vs limits of %d->%d, +/-%d\n",
84  unicharset.id_to_unichar(class_id),
85  bad ? "Misfit" : "OK", top, min_top, max_top,
86  static_cast<int>(x_ht_acceptance_tolerance));
87  }
88  }
89  }
90  return bad_blobs;
91 }

123  }

127  // Find the x-coordinate of left-most char_box, which could be
128  // nonzero if the word image was padded before recognition took place.
129  int x_offset = -1;
130  for (int i = 0; i < num_chars; ++i) {
131  Box* char_box = boxaGetBox(char_boxes, i, L_CLONE);
132  if (x_offset < 0 || char_box->x < x_offset) {
133  x_offset = char_box->x;
134  }
135  boxDestroy(&char_box);
136  }
137 
138  for (int i = 0; i < num_chars; ++i) {
139  Box* char_box = boxaGetBox(char_boxes, i, L_CLONE);
140  TBOX tbox = char_box_to_tbox(char_box, word_box, x_offset);
141  boxDestroy(&char_box);
142  box_word->InsertBox(i, tbox);
143  }
144  return true;
145 }

Definition at line 283 of file cube_control.cpp.

284  {
285  float combiner_prob = tess_cube_combiner_->CombineResults(tess_word,
286  cube_obj);
287  // If combiner probability is greater than tess/cube combiner
288  // classifier threshold, i.e. tesseract wins, then just return the
289  // tesseract result unchanged, as the combiner knows nothing about how
290  // correct the answer is. If cube and tesseract agree, then improve the
291  // scores before returning.
292  WERD_CHOICE* tess_best = tess_word->best_choice;
293  WERD_CHOICE* cube_best = cube_word->best_choice;
294  if (cube_debug_level || classify_debug_level) {
295  tprintf("Combiner prob = %g vs threshold %g\n",
296  combiner_prob, cube_cntxt_->Params()->CombinerClassifierThresh());
297  }
298  if (combiner_prob >=
299  cube_cntxt_->Params()->CombinerClassifierThresh()) {
300  if (tess_best->unichar_string() == cube_best->unichar_string()) {
301  // Cube and tess agree, so improve the scores.
302  tess_best->set_rating(tess_best->rating() / 2);
303  tess_best->set_certainty(tess_best->certainty() / 2);
304  }
305  return;
306  }
307  // Cube wins.
308  // It is better for the language combiner to have all tesseract scores,
309  // so put them in the cube result.
310  cube_best->set_rating(tess_best->rating());
311  cube_best->set_certainty(tess_best->certainty());
312  if (cube_debug_level || classify_debug_level) {
313  tprintf("Cube INFO: tesseract result replaced by cube: %s -> %s\n",
314  tess_best->unichar_string().string(),
315  cube_best->unichar_string().string());
316  }
317  tess_word->ConsumeWordResults(cube_word);
318 }

327  {
328  // Run cube
329  WordAltList *cube_alt_list = cube_obj->RecognizeWord();
330  if (!cube_alt_list || cube_alt_list->AltCount() <= 0) {
331  if (cube_debug_level > 0) {
332  tprintf("Cube returned nothing for word at:");
333  word->word->bounding_box().print();
334  }
335  word->SetupFake(unicharset);
336  return false;
337  }
338 
339  // Get cube's best result and its probability, mapped to tesseract's
340  // certainty range
341  char_32 *cube_best_32 = cube_alt_list->Alt(0);
342  double cube_prob = CubeUtils::Cost2Prob(cube_alt_list->AltCost(0));
343  float cube_certainty = convert_prob_to_tess_certainty(cube_prob);
344  string cube_best_str;
345  CubeUtils::UTF32ToUTF8(cube_best_32, &cube_best_str);
346 
347  // Retrieve Cube's character bounding boxes and CharSamples,
348  // corresponding to the most recent call to RecognizeWord().
349  Boxa *char_boxes = NULL;
350  CharSamp **char_samples = NULL;;
351  int num_chars;
352  if (!extract_cube_state(cube_obj, &num_chars, &char_boxes, &char_samples)
353  && cube_debug_level > 0) {
354  tprintf("Cube WARNING (Tesseract::cube_recognize): Cannot extract "
355  "cube state.\n");
356  word->SetupFake(unicharset);
357  return false;
358  }
359 
360  // Convert cube's character bounding boxes to a BoxWord.
361  BoxWord cube_box_word;
362  TBOX tess_word_box = word->word->bounding_box();
363  if (word->denorm.block() != NULL)
364  tess_word_box.rotate(word->denorm.block()->re_rotation());
365  bool box_word_success = create_cube_box_word(char_boxes, num_chars,
366  tess_word_box,
367  &cube_box_word);
368  boxaDestroy(&char_boxes);
369  if (!box_word_success) {
370  if (cube_debug_level > 0) {
371  tprintf("Cube WARNING (Tesseract::cube_recognize): Could not "
372  "create cube BoxWord\n");
373  }
374  word->SetupFake(unicharset);
375  return false;
376  }
377 
378  // Fill tesseract result's fields with cube results
379  fill_werd_res(cube_box_word, cube_best_str.c_str(), word);
380 
381  // Create cube's best choice.
382  BLOB_CHOICE** choices = new BLOB_CHOICE*[num_chars];
383  for (int i = 0; i < num_chars; ++i) {
384  UNICHAR_ID uch_id =
385  cube_cntxt_->CharacterSet()->UnicharID(char_samples[i]->StrLabel());
386  choices[i] = new BLOB_CHOICE(uch_id, 0.0, cube_certainty, -1, -1,
387  0, 0, 0, 0, BCC_STATIC_CLASSIFIER);
388  }
389  word->FakeClassifyWord(num_chars, choices);
390  // within a word, cube recognizes the word in reading order.
391  word->best_choice->set_unichars_in_script_order(true);
392  delete [] choices;
393  delete [] char_samples;
394 
395  // Some sanity checks
396  ASSERT_HOST(word->best_choice->length() == word->reject_map.length());
397 
398  if (cube_debug_level || classify_debug_level) {
399  tprintf("Cube result: %s r=%g, c=%g\n",
400  word->best_choice->unichar_string().string(),
401  word->best_choice->rating(),
402  word->best_choice->certainty());
403  }
404  return true;
405 }

void tesseract::Tesseract::dictionary_correction_pass ( PAGE_RES *  page_res)

Definition at line 1629 of file control.cpp.

1629  {
1630  PAGE_RES_IT word_it(page_res);
1631  for (WERD_RES* word = word_it.word(); word != NULL;
1632  word = word_it.forward()) {
1633  if (word->best_choices.singleton())
1634  continue; // There are no alternates.
1635 
1636  WERD_CHOICE* best = word->best_choice;
1637  if (word->tesseract->getDict().valid_word(*best) != 0)
1638  continue; // The best choice is in the dictionary.
1639 
1640  WERD_CHOICE_IT choice_it(&word->best_choices);
1641  for (choice_it.mark_cycle_pt(); !choice_it.cycled_list();
1642  choice_it.forward()) {
1643  WERD_CHOICE* alternate = choice_it.data();
1644  if (word->tesseract->getDict().valid_word(*alternate)) {
1645  // The alternate choice is in the dictionary.
1646  if (tessedit_bigram_debug) {
1647  tprintf("Dictionary correction replaces best choice '%s' with '%s'\n",
1648  best->unichar_string().string(),
1649  alternate->unichar_string().string());
1650  }
1651  // Replace the 'best' choice with a better choice.
1652  word->ReplaceBestChoice(alternate);
1653  break;
1654  }
1655  }
1656  }
1657 }

void tesseract::Tesseract::doc_and_block_rejection ( PAGE_RES_IT &  page_res_it,

Definition at line 235 of file docqual.cpp.

237  {
238  inT16 block_no = 0;
239  inT16 row_no = 0;
240  BLOCK_RES *current_block;
241  ROW_RES *current_row;
242 
243  BOOL8 rej_word;
244  BOOL8 prev_word_rejected;
245  inT16 char_quality = 0;
246  inT16 accepted_char_quality;
247 
248  if (page_res_it.page_res->rej_count * 100.0 /
249  page_res_it.page_res->char_count > tessedit_reject_doc_percent) {
250  reject_whole_page(page_res_it);
251  if (tessedit_debug_doc_rejection) {
252  tprintf("REJECT ALL #chars: %d #Rejects: %d; \n",
253  page_res_it.page_res->char_count,
254  page_res_it.page_res->rej_count);
255  }
256  } else {
257  if (tessedit_debug_doc_rejection) {
258  tprintf("NO PAGE REJECTION #chars: %d # Rejects: %d; \n",
259  page_res_it.page_res->char_count,
260  page_res_it.page_res->rej_count);
261  }
262 
263  /* Walk blocks testing for block rejection */
264 
265  page_res_it.restart_page();
266  WERD_RES* word;
267  while ((word = page_res_it.word()) != NULL) {
268  current_block = page_res_it.block();
269  block_no = current_block->block->index();
270  if (current_block->char_count > 0 &&
271  (current_block->rej_count * 100.0 / current_block->char_count) >
272  tessedit_reject_block_percent) {
273  if (tessedit_debug_block_rejection) {
274  tprintf("REJECTING BLOCK %d #chars: %d; #Rejects: %d\n",
275  block_no, current_block->char_count,
276  current_block->rej_count);
277  }
278  prev_word_rejected = FALSE;
279  while ((word = page_res_it.word()) != NULL &&
280  (page_res_it.block() == current_block)) {
281  if (tessedit_preserve_blk_rej_perfect_wds) {
282  rej_word = word->reject_map.reject_count() > 0 ||
283  word->reject_map.length () < tessedit_preserve_min_wd_len;
284  if (rej_word && tessedit_dont_blkrej_good_wds &&
285  word->reject_map.length() >= tessedit_preserve_min_wd_len &&
286  acceptable_word_string(
287  *word->uch_set,
288  word->best_choice->unichar_string().string(),
289  word->best_choice->unichar_lengths().string()) !=
290  AC_UNACCEPTABLE) {
291  word_char_quality(word, page_res_it.row()->row,
292  &char_quality,
293  &accepted_char_quality);
294  rej_word = char_quality != word->reject_map.length();
295  }
296  } else {
297  rej_word = TRUE;
298  }
299  if (rej_word) {
300  /*
301  Reject spacing if both current and prev words are rejected.
302  NOTE - this is NOT restricted to FUZZY spaces. - When tried this
303  generated more space errors.
304  */
305  if (tessedit_use_reject_spaces &&
306  prev_word_rejected &&
307  page_res_it.prev_row() == page_res_it.row() &&
308  word->word->space() == 1)
309  word->reject_spaces = TRUE;
310  word->reject_map.rej_word_block_rej();
311  }
312  prev_word_rejected = rej_word;
313  page_res_it.forward();
314  }
315  } else {
316  if (tessedit_debug_block_rejection) {
317  tprintf("NOT REJECTING BLOCK %d #chars: %d # Rejects: %d; \n",
318  block_no, page_res_it.block()->char_count,
319  page_res_it.block()->rej_count);
320  }
321 
322  /* Walk rows in block testing for row rejection */
323  row_no = 0;
324  while (page_res_it.word() != NULL &&
325  page_res_it.block() == current_block) {
326  current_row = page_res_it.row();
327  row_no++;
328  /* Reject whole row if:
329  fraction of chars on row which are rejected exceed a limit AND
330  fraction rejects which occur in WHOLE WERD rejects is LESS THAN a
331  limit
332  */
333  if (current_row->char_count > 0 &&
334  (current_row->rej_count * 100.0 / current_row->char_count) >
335  tessedit_reject_row_percent &&
336  (current_row->whole_word_rej_count * 100.0 /
337  current_row->rej_count) <
338  tessedit_whole_wd_rej_row_percent) {
339  if (tessedit_debug_block_rejection) {
340  tprintf("REJECTING ROW %d #chars: %d; #Rejects: %d\n",
341  row_no, current_row->char_count,
342  current_row->rej_count);
343  }
344  prev_word_rejected = FALSE;
345  while ((word = page_res_it.word()) != NULL &&
346  page_res_it.row () == current_row) {
347  /* Preserve words on good docs unless they are mostly rejected*/
348  if (!tessedit_row_rej_good_docs && good_quality_doc) {
349  rej_word = word->reject_map.reject_count() /
350  static_cast<float>(word->reject_map.length()) >
351  tessedit_good_doc_still_rowrej_wd;
352  } else if (tessedit_preserve_row_rej_perfect_wds) {
353  /* Preserve perfect words anyway */
354  rej_word = word->reject_map.reject_count() > 0 ||
355  word->reject_map.length () < tessedit_preserve_min_wd_len;
356  if (rej_word && tessedit_dont_rowrej_good_wds &&
357  word->reject_map.length() >= tessedit_preserve_min_wd_len &&
358  acceptable_word_string(*word->uch_set,
359  word->best_choice->unichar_string().string(),
360  word->best_choice->unichar_lengths().string()) !=
361  AC_UNACCEPTABLE) {
362  word_char_quality(word, page_res_it.row()->row,
363  &char_quality,
364  &accepted_char_quality);
365  rej_word = char_quality != word->reject_map.length();
366  }
367  } else {
368  rej_word = TRUE;
369  }
370  if (rej_word) {
371  /*
372  Reject spacing if both current and prev words are rejected.
373  NOTE - this is NOT restricted to FUZZY spaces. - When tried
374  this generated more space errors.
375  */
376  if (tessedit_use_reject_spaces &&
377  prev_word_rejected &&
378  page_res_it.prev_row() == page_res_it.row() &&
379  word->word->space () == 1)
380  word->reject_spaces = TRUE;
381  word->reject_map.rej_word_row_rej();
382  }
383  prev_word_rejected = rej_word;
384  page_res_it.forward();
385  }
386  } else {
387  if (tessedit_debug_block_rejection) {
388  tprintf("NOT REJECTING ROW %d #chars: %d # Rejects: %d; \n",
389  row_no, current_row->char_count, current_row->rej_count);
390  }
391  while (page_res_it.word() != NULL &&
392  page_res_it.row() == current_row)
393  page_res_it.forward();
394  }
395  }
396  }
397  }
398  }
399 }

void tesseract::Tesseract::dont_allow_1Il ( WERD_RES *  word)

Definition at line 526 of file reject.cpp.

526  {
527  int i = 0;
528  int offset;
529  int word_len = word->reject_map.length();
530  const char *s = word->best_choice->unichar_string().string();
531  const char *lengths = word->best_choice->unichar_lengths().string();
532  BOOL8 accepted_1Il = FALSE;
533 
534  for (i = 0, offset = 0; i < word_len;
535  offset += word->best_choice->unichar_lengths()[i++]) {
536  if (word->reject_map[i].accepted()) {
537  if (STRING(conflict_set_I_l_1).contains(s[offset])) {
538  accepted_1Il = TRUE;
539  } else {
540  if (word->uch_set->get_isalpha(s + offset, lengths[i]) ||
541  word->uch_set->get_isdigit(s + offset, lengths[i]))
542  return; // >=1 non 1Il ch accepted
543  }
544  }
545  }
546  if (!accepted_1Il)
547  return; //Nothing to worry about
548 
549  for (i = 0, offset = 0; i < word_len;
550  offset += word->best_choice->unichar_lengths()[i++]) {
551  if (STRING(conflict_set_I_l_1).contains(s[offset]) &&
552  word->reject_map[i].accepted())
553  word->reject_map[i].setrej_postNN_1Il();
554  }
555 }

452  {
453  WERD_RES_IT word_res_it(&perm);
454 
455  if (debug_fix_space_level > 0) {
456  if (mode == 1) {
457  stats_.dump_words_str = "";
458  for (word_res_it.mark_cycle_pt(); !word_res_it.cycled_list();
459  word_res_it.forward()) {
460  if (!word_res_it.data()->part_of_combo) {
461  stats_.dump_words_str +=
462  word_res_it.data()->best_choice->unichar_string();
463  stats_.dump_words_str += ' ';
464  }
465  }
466  }
467 
468  if (debug_fix_space_level > 1) {
469  switch (mode) {
470  case 1:
471  tprintf("EXTRACTED (%d): \"", score);
472  break;
473  case 2:
474  tprintf("TESTED (%d): \"", score);
475  break;
476  case 3:
477  tprintf("RETURNED (%d): \"", score);
478  break;

486  (int)word_res_it.data()->best_choice->permuter());
487  }
488  }

Definition: tface.cpp:63
inT16 tesseract::Tesseract::eval_word_spacing ( WERD_RES_LIST &  word_res_list)

Definition at line 241 of file fixspace.cpp.

241  {
242  WERD_RES_IT word_res_it(&word_res_list);
243  inT16 total_score = 0;
244  inT16 word_count = 0;
245  inT16 done_word_count = 0;
246  inT16 word_len;
247  inT16 i;
248  inT16 offset;
249  WERD_RES *word; // current word
250  inT16 prev_word_score = 0;
251  BOOL8 prev_word_done = FALSE;
252  BOOL8 prev_char_1 = FALSE; // prev ch a "1/I/l"?
253  BOOL8 prev_char_digit = FALSE; // prev ch 2..9 or 0
254  BOOL8 current_char_1 = FALSE;
255  BOOL8 current_word_ok_so_far;
256  STRING punct_chars = "!\"`',.:;";
257  BOOL8 prev_char_punct = FALSE;
258  BOOL8 current_char_punct = FALSE;
259  BOOL8 word_done = FALSE;
260 
261  do {
262  word = word_res_it.data();
263  word_done = fixspace_thinks_word_done(word);
264  word_count++;
265  if (word->tess_failed) {
266  total_score += prev_word_score;
267  if (prev_word_done)
268  done_word_count++;
269  prev_word_score = 0;
270  prev_char_1 = FALSE;
271  prev_char_digit = FALSE;
272  prev_word_done = FALSE;
273  } else {
274  /*
275  Can we add the prev word score and potentially count this word?
276  Yes IF it didnt end in a 1 when the first char of this word is a digit
277  AND it didnt end in a digit when the first char of this word is a 1
278  */
279  word_len = word->reject_map.length();
280  current_word_ok_so_far = FALSE;
281  if (!((prev_char_1 && digit_or_numeric_punct(word, 0)) ||
282  (prev_char_digit && (
283  (word_done &&
284  word->best_choice->unichar_lengths().string()[0] == 1 &&
285  word->best_choice->unichar_string()[0] == '1') ||
286  (!word_done && STRING(conflict_set_I_l_1).contains(
287  word->best_choice->unichar_string()[0])))))) {
288  total_score += prev_word_score;
289  if (prev_word_done)
290  done_word_count++;
291  current_word_ok_so_far = word_done;
292  }
293 
294  if (current_word_ok_so_far) {
295  prev_word_done = TRUE;
296  prev_word_score = word_len;
297  } else {
298  prev_word_done = FALSE;
299  prev_word_score = 0;
300  }
301 
302  /* Add 1 to total score for every joined 1 regardless of context and
303  rejtn */
304  for (i = 0, prev_char_1 = FALSE; i < word_len; i++) {
305  current_char_1 = word->best_choice->unichar_string()[i] == '1';
306  if (prev_char_1 || (current_char_1 && (i > 0)))
307  total_score++;
308  prev_char_1 = current_char_1;
309  }
310 
311  /* Add 1 to total score for every joined punctuation regardless of context
312  and rejtn */
313  if (tessedit_prefer_joined_punct) {
314  for (i = 0, offset = 0, prev_char_punct = FALSE; i < word_len;
315  offset += word->best_choice->unichar_lengths()[i++]) {
316  current_char_punct =
317  punct_chars.contains(word->best_choice->unichar_string()[offset]);
318  if (prev_char_punct || (current_char_punct && i > 0))
319  total_score++;
320  prev_char_punct = current_char_punct;
321  }
322  }
323  prev_char_digit = digit_or_numeric_punct(word, word_len - 1);
324  for (i = 0, offset = 0; i < word_len - 1;
325  offset += word->best_choice->unichar_lengths()[i++]);
326  prev_char_1 =
327  ((word_done && (word->best_choice->unichar_string()[offset] == '1'))
328  || (!word_done && STRING(conflict_set_I_l_1).contains(
329  word->best_choice->unichar_string()[offset])));
330  }
331  /* Find next word */
332  do {
333  word_res_it.forward();
334  } while (word_res_it.data()->part_of_combo);
335  } while (!word_res_it.at_first());
336  total_score += prev_word_score;
337  if (prev_word_done)
338  done_word_count++;
339  if (done_word_count == word_count)
340  return PERFECT_WERDS;
341  else
342  return total_score;
343 }

102  if (!*char_samples)
103  return false;
104  return true;
105 }

Definition at line 550 of file applybox.cpp.

551  {
552  // Classify all required combinations of blobs and save results in choices.
553  int word_length = word_res->box_word->length();
554  GenericVector<BLOB_CHOICE_LIST*>* choices =
555  new GenericVector<BLOB_CHOICE_LIST*>[word_length];
556  for (int i = 0; i < word_length; ++i) {
557  for (int j = 1; j <= kMaxGroupSize && i + j <= word_length; ++j) {
558  BLOB_CHOICE_LIST* match_result = classify_piece(
559  word_res->seam_array, i, i + j - 1, "Applybox",
560  word_res->chopped_word, word_res->blamer_bundle);
561  if (applybox_debug > 2) {
562  tprintf("%d+%d:", i, j);
563  print_ratings_list("Segment:", match_result, unicharset);
564  }
565  choices[i].push_back(match_result);
566  }
567  }
568  // Search the segmentation graph for the target text. Must be an exact
569  // match. Using wildcards makes it difficult to find the correct
570  // segmentation even when it is there.
571  word_res->best_state.clear();
572  GenericVector<int> search_segmentation;
573  float best_rating = 0.0f;
574  SearchForText(choices, 0, word_length, target_text, 0, 0.0f,
575  &search_segmentation, &best_rating, &word_res->best_state);
576  for (int i = 0; i < word_length; ++i)
577  choices[i].delete_data_pointers();
578  delete [] choices;
579  if (word_res->best_state.empty()) {
580  // Build the original segmentation and if it is the same length as the
581  // truth, assume it will do.
582  int blob_count = 1;
583  for (int s = 0; s < word_res->seam_array.size(); ++s) {
584  SEAM* seam = word_res->seam_array[s];
585  if (seam->split1 == NULL) {
586  word_res->best_state.push_back(blob_count);
587  blob_count = 1;
588  } else {
589  ++blob_count;
590  }
591  }
592  word_res->best_state.push_back(blob_count);
593  if (word_res->best_state.size() != target_text.size()) {
594  word_res->best_state.clear(); // No good. Original segmentation bad size.
595  return false;
596  }
597  }
598  word_res->correct_text.clear();
599  for (int i = 0; i < target_text.size(); ++i) {
600  word_res->correct_text.push_back(
601  STRING(unicharset.id_to_unichar(target_text[i])));
602  }
603  return true;
604 }

Definition at line 145 of file fixspace.cpp.

147  {
148  inT16 best_score;
149  WERD_RES_LIST current_perm;
150  inT16 current_score;
151  BOOL8 improved = FALSE;
152 
153  best_score = eval_word_spacing(best_perm); // default score
154  dump_words(best_perm, best_score, 1, improved);
155 
156  if (best_score != PERFECT_WERDS)
157  initialise_search(best_perm, current_perm);
158 
159  while ((best_score != PERFECT_WERDS) && !current_perm.empty()) {
160  match_current_words(current_perm, row, block);
161  current_score = eval_word_spacing(current_perm);
162  dump_words(current_perm, current_score, 2, improved);
163  if (current_score > best_score) {
164  best_perm.clear();
165  best_perm.deep_copy(&current_perm, &WERD_RES::deep_copy);
166  best_score = current_score;
167  improved = TRUE;
168  }
169  if (current_score < PERFECT_WERDS)
170  transform_to_next_perm(current_perm);
171  }
172  dump_words(best_perm, best_score, 3, improved);
173 }

50  {
51  BLOCK_RES_IT block_res_it;
52  ROW_RES_IT row_res_it;
53  WERD_RES_IT word_res_it_from;
54  WERD_RES_IT word_res_it_to;
55  WERD_RES *word_res;
56  WERD_RES_LIST fuzzy_space_words;
57  inT16 new_length;
58  BOOL8 prevent_null_wd_fixsp; // DONT process blobless wds
59  inT32 word_index; // current word
60 
61  block_res_it.set_to_list(&page_res->block_res_list);
62  word_index = 0;
63  for (block_res_it.mark_cycle_pt(); !block_res_it.cycled_list();
64  block_res_it.forward()) {
65  row_res_it.set_to_list(&block_res_it.data()->row_res_list);
66  for (row_res_it.mark_cycle_pt(); !row_res_it.cycled_list();
67  row_res_it.forward()) {
68  word_res_it_from.set_to_list(&row_res_it.data()->word_res_list);
69  while (!word_res_it_from.at_last()) {
70  word_res = word_res_it_from.data();
71  while (!word_res_it_from.at_last() &&
72  !(word_res->combination ||
73  word_res_it_from.data_relative(1)->word->flag(W_FUZZY_NON) ||
74  word_res_it_from.data_relative(1)->word->flag(W_FUZZY_SP))) {
75  fix_sp_fp_word(word_res_it_from, row_res_it.data()->row,
76  block_res_it.data()->block);
77  word_res = word_res_it_from.forward();
78  word_index++;
79  if (monitor != NULL) {
80  monitor->ocr_alive = TRUE;
81  monitor->progress = 90 + 5 * word_index / word_count;
82  if (monitor->deadline_exceeded() ||
83  (monitor->cancel != NULL &&
84  (*monitor->cancel)(monitor->cancel_this, stats_.dict_words)))
85  return;
86  }
87  }
88 
89  if (!word_res_it_from.at_last()) {
90  word_res_it_to = word_res_it_from;
91  prevent_null_wd_fixsp =
92  word_res->word->cblob_list()->empty();
93  if (check_debug_pt(word_res, 60))
94  debug_fix_space_level.set_value(10);
95  word_res_it_to.forward();
96  word_index++;
97  if (monitor != NULL) {
98  monitor->ocr_alive = TRUE;
99  monitor->progress = 90 + 5 * word_index / word_count;
100  if (monitor->deadline_exceeded() ||
101  (monitor->cancel != NULL &&
102  (*monitor->cancel)(monitor->cancel_this, stats_.dict_words)))
103  return;
104  }
105  while (!word_res_it_to.at_last () &&
106  (word_res_it_to.data_relative(1)->word->flag(W_FUZZY_NON) ||
107  word_res_it_to.data_relative(1)->word->flag(W_FUZZY_SP))) {
108  if (check_debug_pt(word_res, 60))
109  debug_fix_space_level.set_value(10);
110  if (word_res->word->cblob_list()->empty())
111  prevent_null_wd_fixsp = TRUE;
112  word_res = word_res_it_to.forward();
113  }
114  if (check_debug_pt(word_res, 60))
115  debug_fix_space_level.set_value(10);
116  if (word_res->word->cblob_list()->empty())
117  prevent_null_wd_fixsp = TRUE;
118  if (prevent_null_wd_fixsp) {
119  word_res_it_from = word_res_it_to;
120  } else {
121  fuzzy_space_words.assign_to_sublist(&word_res_it_from,
122  &word_res_it_to);
123  fix_fuzzy_space_list(fuzzy_space_words,
124  row_res_it.data()->row,
125  block_res_it.data()->block);
126  new_length = fuzzy_space_words.length();
127  word_res_it_from.add_list_before(&fuzzy_space_words);
128  for (;
129  !word_res_it_from.at_last() && new_length > 0;
130  new_length--) {
131  word_res_it_from.forward();
132  }
133  }
134  if (test_pt)
135  debug_fix_space_level.set_value(0);
136  }
137  fix_sp_fp_word(word_res_it_from, row_res_it.data()->row,
138  block_res_it.data()->block);
139  // Last word in row
140  }
141  }
142  }
143 }

572  {
573  inT16 best_score;
574  WERD_RES_IT best_perm_it(&best_perm);
575  WERD_RES_LIST current_perm;
576  WERD_RES_IT current_perm_it(&current_perm);
577  WERD_RES *old_word_res;
578  inT16 current_score;
579  BOOL8 improved = FALSE;
580 
581  best_score = fp_eval_word_spacing(best_perm); // default score
582 
583  dump_words(best_perm, best_score, 1, improved);
584 
585  old_word_res = best_perm_it.data();
586  // Even deep_copy doesn't copy the underlying WERD unless its combination
587  // flag is true!.
588  old_word_res->combination = TRUE; // Kludge to force deep copy
589  current_perm_it.add_to_end(WERD_RES::deep_copy(old_word_res));
590  old_word_res->combination = FALSE; // Undo kludge
591 
592  break_noisiest_blob_word(current_perm);
593 
594  while (best_score != PERFECT_WERDS && !current_perm.empty()) {
595  match_current_words(current_perm, row, block);
596  current_score = fp_eval_word_spacing(current_perm);
597  dump_words(current_perm, current_score, 2, improved);
598  if (current_score > best_score) {
599  best_perm.clear();
600  best_perm.deep_copy(&current_perm, &WERD_RES::deep_copy);
601  best_score = current_score;
602  improved = TRUE;
603  }
604  if (current_score < PERFECT_WERDS) {
605  break_noisiest_blob_word(current_perm);
606  }
607  }
608  dump_words(best_perm, best_score, 3, improved);
609 }

void tesseract::Tesseract::fix_rep_char ( PAGE_RES_IT *  page_res_it)

fix_rep_char() The word is a repeated char. (Leader.) Find the repeated char character. Create the appropriate single-word or multi-word sequence according to the size of spaces in between blobs, and correct the classifications where some of the characters disagree with the majority.

Definition at line 1226 of file control.cpp.

1226  {
1227  WERD_RES *word_res = page_res_it->word();
1228  const WERD_CHOICE &word = *(word_res->best_choice);
1229 
1230  // Find the frequency of each unique character in the word.
1231  SortHelper<UNICHAR_ID> rep_ch(word.length());
1232  for (int i = 0; i < word.length(); ++i) {
1233  rep_ch.Add(word.unichar_id(i), 1);
1234  }
1235 
1236  // Find the most frequent result.
1237  UNICHAR_ID maxch_id = INVALID_UNICHAR_ID; // most common char
1238  int max_count = rep_ch.MaxCount(&maxch_id);
1239  // Find the best exemplar of a classifier result for maxch_id.
1240  BLOB_CHOICE* best_choice = FindBestMatchingChoice(maxch_id, word_res);
1241  if (best_choice == NULL) {
1242  tprintf("Failed to find a choice for %s, occurring %d times\n",
1243  word_res->uch_set->debug_str(maxch_id).string(), max_count);
1244  return;
1245  }
1246  word_res->done = TRUE;
1247 
1248  // Measure the mean space.
1249  int total_gap = 0;
1250  int gap_count = 0;
1251  WERD* werd = word_res->word;
1252  C_BLOB_IT blob_it(werd->cblob_list());
1253  C_BLOB* prev_blob = blob_it.data();
1254  for (blob_it.forward(); !blob_it.at_first(); blob_it.forward()) {
1255  C_BLOB* blob = blob_it.data();
1256  int gap = blob->bounding_box().left();
1257  gap -= prev_blob->bounding_box().right();
1258  total_gap += gap;
1259  ++gap_count;
1260  prev_blob = blob;
1261  }
1262  // Just correct existing classification.
1263  CorrectRepcharChoices(best_choice, word_res);
1264  word_res->reject_map.initialise(word.length());
1265 }

506  if (word->done)

508

510  Use all the standard pass 2 conditions for mode 5 in set_done() in

void tesseract::Tesseract::flip_0O ( WERD_RES *  word)

Definition at line 673 of file reject.cpp.

673  {
674  WERD_CHOICE *best_choice = word_res->best_choice;
675  int i;
676  TBOX out_box;
677 
678  if (!tessedit_flip_0O)
679  return;
680 
681  int num_blobs = word_res->rebuild_word->NumBlobs();
682  for (i = 0; i < best_choice->length() && i < num_blobs; ++i) {
683  TBLOB* blob = word_res->rebuild_word->blobs[i];
684  if (word_res->uch_set->get_isupper(best_choice->unichar_id(i)) ||
685  word_res->uch_set->get_isdigit(best_choice->unichar_id(i))) {
686  out_box = blob->bounding_box();
687  if ((out_box.top() < kBlnBaselineOffset + kBlnXHeight) ||
688  (out_box.bottom() > kBlnBaselineOffset + kBlnXHeight / 4))
689  return; //Beware words with sub/superscripts
690  }
691  }
692  UNICHAR_ID unichar_0 = word_res->uch_set->unichar_to_id("0");
693  UNICHAR_ID unichar_O = word_res->uch_set->unichar_to_id("O");
694  if (unichar_0 == INVALID_UNICHAR_ID ||
695  !word_res->uch_set->get_enabled(unichar_0) ||
696  unichar_O == INVALID_UNICHAR_ID ||
697  !word_res->uch_set->get_enabled(unichar_O)) {
698  return; // 0 or O are not present/enabled in unicharset
699  }
700  for (i = 1; i < best_choice->length(); ++i) {
701  if (best_choice->unichar_id(i) == unichar_0 ||
702  best_choice->unichar_id(i) == unichar_O) {
703  /* A0A */
704  if ((i+1) < best_choice->length() &&
705  non_O_upper(*word_res->uch_set, best_choice->unichar_id(i-1)) &&
706  non_O_upper(*word_res->uch_set, best_choice->unichar_id(i+1))) {
707  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_O, i);
708  }
709  /* A00A */
710  if (non_O_upper(*word_res->uch_set, best_choice->unichar_id(i-1)) &&
711  (i+1) < best_choice->length() &&
712  (best_choice->unichar_id(i+1) == unichar_0 ||
713  best_choice->unichar_id(i+1) == unichar_O) &&
714  (i+2) < best_choice->length() &&
715  non_O_upper(*word_res->uch_set, best_choice->unichar_id(i+2))) {
716  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_O, i);
717  i++;
718  }
719  /* AA0<non digit or end of word> */
720  if ((i > 1) &&
721  non_O_upper(*word_res->uch_set, best_choice->unichar_id(i-2)) &&
722  non_O_upper(*word_res->uch_set, best_choice->unichar_id(i-1)) &&
723  (((i+1) < best_choice->length() &&
724  !word_res->uch_set->get_isdigit(best_choice->unichar_id(i+1)) &&
725  !word_res->uch_set->eq(best_choice->unichar_id(i+1), "l") &&
726  !word_res->uch_set->eq(best_choice->unichar_id(i+1), "I")) ||
727  (i == best_choice->length() - 1))) {
728  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_O, i);
729  }
730  /* 9O9 */
731  if (non_0_digit(*word_res->uch_set, best_choice->unichar_id(i-1)) &&
732  (i+1) < best_choice->length() &&
733  non_0_digit(*word_res->uch_set, best_choice->unichar_id(i+1))) {
734  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_0, i);
735  }
736  /* 9OOO */
737  if (non_0_digit(*word_res->uch_set, best_choice->unichar_id(i-1)) &&
738  (i+2) < best_choice->length() &&
739  (best_choice->unichar_id(i+1) == unichar_0 ||
740  best_choice->unichar_id(i+1) == unichar_O) &&
741  (best_choice->unichar_id(i+2) == unichar_0 ||
742  best_choice->unichar_id(i+2) == unichar_O)) {
743  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_0, i);
744  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_0, i+1);
745  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_0, i+2);
746  i += 2;
747  }
748  /* 9OO<non upper> */
749  if (non_0_digit(*word_res->uch_set, best_choice->unichar_id(i-1)) &&
750  (i+2) < best_choice->length() &&
751  (best_choice->unichar_id(i+1) == unichar_0 ||
752  best_choice->unichar_id(i+1) == unichar_O) &&
753  !word_res->uch_set->get_isupper(best_choice->unichar_id(i+2))) {
754  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_0, i);
755  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_0, i+1);
756  i++;
757  }
758  /* 9O<non upper> */
759  if (non_0_digit(*word_res->uch_set, best_choice->unichar_id(i-1)) &&
760  (i+1) < best_choice->length() &&
761  !word_res->uch_set->get_isupper(best_choice->unichar_id(i+1))) {
762  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_0, i);
763  }
764  /* 9[.,]OOO.. */
765  if ((i > 1) &&
766  (word_res->uch_set->eq(best_choice->unichar_id(i-1), ".") ||
767  word_res->uch_set->eq(best_choice->unichar_id(i-1), ",")) &&
768  (word_res->uch_set->get_isdigit(best_choice->unichar_id(i-2)) ||
769  best_choice->unichar_id(i-2) == unichar_O)) {
770  if (best_choice->unichar_id(i-2) == unichar_O) {
771  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_0, i-2);
772  }
773  while (i < best_choice->length() &&
774  (best_choice->unichar_id(i) == unichar_O ||
775  best_choice->unichar_id(i) == unichar_0)) {
776  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_0, i);
777  i++;
778  }
779  i--;
780  }
781  }
782  }
783 }

void tesseract::Tesseract::flip_hyphens ( WERD_RES *  word)

Definition at line 616 of file reject.cpp.

616  {
617  WERD_CHOICE *best_choice = word_res->best_choice;
618  int i;
619  int prev_right = -9999;
620  int next_left;
621  TBOX out_box;
622  float aspect_ratio;
623 
624  if (tessedit_lower_flip_hyphen <= 1)
625  return;
626 
627  int num_blobs = word_res->rebuild_word->NumBlobs();
628  UNICHAR_ID unichar_dash = word_res->uch_set->unichar_to_id("-");
629  for (i = 0; i < best_choice->length() && i < num_blobs; ++i) {
630  TBLOB* blob = word_res->rebuild_word->blobs[i];
631  out_box = blob->bounding_box();
632  if (i + 1 == num_blobs)
633  next_left = 9999;
634  else
635  next_left = word_res->rebuild_word->blobs[i + 1]->bounding_box().left();
636  // Dont touch small or touching blobs - it is too dangerous.
637  if ((out_box.width() > 8 * word_res->denorm.x_scale()) &&
638  (out_box.left() > prev_right) && (out_box.right() < next_left)) {
639  aspect_ratio = out_box.width() / (float) out_box.height();
640  if (word_res->uch_set->eq(best_choice->unichar_id(i), ".")) {
641  if (aspect_ratio >= tessedit_upper_flip_hyphen &&
642  word_res->uch_set->contains_unichar_id(unichar_dash) &&
643  word_res->uch_set->get_enabled(unichar_dash)) {
644  /* Certain HYPHEN */
645  best_choice->set_unichar_id(unichar_dash, i);
646  if (word_res->reject_map[i].rejected())
647  word_res->reject_map[i].setrej_hyphen_accept();
648  }
649  if ((aspect_ratio > tessedit_lower_flip_hyphen) &&
650  word_res->reject_map[i].accepted())
651  //Suspected HYPHEN
652  word_res->reject_map[i].setrej_hyphen ();
653  }
654  else if (best_choice->unichar_id(i) == unichar_dash) {
655  if ((aspect_ratio >= tessedit_upper_flip_hyphen) &&
656  (word_res->reject_map[i].rejected()))
657  word_res->reject_map[i].setrej_hyphen_accept();
658  //Certain HYPHEN
659 
660  if ((aspect_ratio <= tessedit_lower_flip_hyphen) &&
661  (word_res->reject_map[i].accepted()))
662  //Suspected HYPHEN
663  word_res->reject_map[i].setrej_hyphen();
664  }
665  }
666  prev_right = out_box.right();
667  }
668 }
TBOX

void tesseract::Tesseract::font_recognition_pass ( PAGE_RES *  page_res)

font_recognition_pass

Smooth the fonts for the document.

Definition at line 1571 of file control.cpp.

1571  {
1572  PAGE_RES_IT page_res_it(page_res);
1573  WERD_RES *word; // current word
1574  STATS doc_fonts(0, font_table_size_); // font counters
1575 
1576  // Gather font id statistics.
1577  for (page_res_it.restart_page(); page_res_it.word() != NULL;
1578  page_res_it.forward()) {
1579  word = page_res_it.word();
1580  if (word->fontinfo != NULL) {
1581  doc_fonts.add(word->fontinfo->universal_id, word->fontinfo_id_count);
1582  }
1583  if (word->fontinfo2 != NULL) {
1584  doc_fonts.add(word->fontinfo2->universal_id, word->fontinfo_id2_count);
1585  }
1586  }
1587  inT16 doc_font; // modal font
1588  inT8 doc_font_count; // modal font
1589  find_modal_font(&doc_fonts, &doc_font, &doc_font_count);
1590  if (doc_font_count == 0)
1591  return;
1592  // Get the modal font pointer.
1593  const FontInfo* modal_font = NULL;
1594  for (page_res_it.restart_page(); page_res_it.word() != NULL;
1595  page_res_it.forward()) {
1596  word = page_res_it.word();
1597  if (word->fontinfo != NULL && word->fontinfo->universal_id == doc_font) {
1598  modal_font = word->fontinfo;
1599  break;
1600  }
1601  if (word->fontinfo2 != NULL && word->fontinfo2->universal_id == doc_font) {
1602  modal_font = word->fontinfo2;
1603  break;
1604  }
1605  }
1606  ASSERT_HOST(modal_font != NULL);
1607 
1608  // Assign modal font to weak words.
1609  for (page_res_it.restart_page(); page_res_it.word() != NULL;
1610  page_res_it.forward()) {
1611  word = page_res_it.word();
1612  int length = word->best_choice->length();
1613 
1614  // 1st choices got 2 pts, so we need to halve the score for the mode.
1615  int count = (word->fontinfo_id_count + 1) / 2;
1616  if (!(count == length || (length > 3 && count >= length * 3 / 4))) {
1617  word->fontinfo = modal_font;
1618  // Counts only get 1 as it came from the doc.
1619  word->fontinfo_id_count = 1;
1620  word->italic = modal_font->is_italic() ? 1 : -1;
1621  word->bold = modal_font->is_bold() ? 1 : -1;
1622  }
1623  }
1624 }

Definition at line 832 of file fixspace.cpp.

832  {
833  WERD_RES_IT word_it(&word_res_list);
834  WERD_RES *word;
835  inT16 word_length;
836  inT16 score = 0;
837  inT16 i;
838  float small_limit = kBlnXHeight * fixsp_small_outlines_size;
839 
840  for (word_it.mark_cycle_pt(); !word_it.cycled_list(); word_it.forward()) {
841  word = word_it.data();
842  if (word->rebuild_word == NULL)
843  continue; // Can't handle cube words.
844  word_length = word->reject_map.length();
845  if (word->done ||
846  word->tess_accepted ||
847  word->best_choice->permuter() == SYSTEM_DAWG_PERM ||
848  word->best_choice->permuter() == FREQ_DAWG_PERM ||
849  word->best_choice->permuter() == USER_DAWG_PERM ||
850  safe_dict_word(word) > 0) {
851  int num_blobs = word->rebuild_word->NumBlobs();
852  UNICHAR_ID space = word->uch_set->unichar_to_id(" ");
853  for (i = 0; i < word->best_choice->length() && i < num_blobs; ++i) {
854  TBLOB* blob = word->rebuild_word->blobs[i];
855  if (word->best_choice->unichar_id(i) == space ||
856  blob_noise_score(blob) < small_limit) {
857  score -= 1; // penalise possibly erroneous non-space
858  } else if (word->reject_map[i].accepted()) {
859  score++;
860  }
861  }
862  }
863  }
864  if (score < 0)
865  score = 0;
866  return score;
867 }
